alert.note: Alert for Annette Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 3:01PM AKST until December 24 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... Multiple frontal bands will pass over the panhandle through the weekend bringing periods of snow. Heavy snow is moving north this afternoon and will be over the northern inner channels tonight. The southern areas have reported from 4 to 8 inches of snow so far with more on the way before becoming a wintry mix or all rain by morning. A break or decrease in snowfall rates remains on track in the morning over the north as the second frontal band tracks into the southern panhandle Saturday morning. This front will continue to move north into the northern areas by the afternoon. This front will bring another round of snow and a chance of freezing rain for the central inner channels with the south changing to all rain through Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected and light freezing rain possible. Storm total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches. * WHERE...Annette Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Possible power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will begin to decrease this evening then increase again early Saturday morning. A period of light freezing rain is possible late Friday night into Saturday before a change over to all rain.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
